But we don't have that ready yet. So, we were focusing on Casper. So, I was showing you sort

the storage forever. And in short, that's just not sustainable. And so, right now in Bitcoin,

problem is that in Ethereum, people can make extremely storage heavy contracts. So, it
makes a lot more possible for people just to break this. Small economic misalignment,

about this. But anyway, so the idea behind rent is so when you put down a big thing of

gets deleted. And yep, I know that kind of sucks and I know all of you are going to hate

any rent at all. But the size of transactions goes up about 20x and there's some new DDoS
vectors. We don't quite know if this is worth it. Basically, the idea, basically, it depends

every three and a half years. As hard drives double a little bit faster, the storage I/O

we say, oh, well, you know, well, it will be harder to DOS this, then it will be to DOS

talking about it. But in short, you're not going to either deal with these like clients
in order to deal with rent. So, I don't know what we're thinking about it. If you have
any data on how storage and storage I/O increases in time, that would really help because, you
know, we want to know how hard this thing is to DOS. All right. So, that's the first
thing. The second thing is CASPER. You wouldn't hear about CASPER all Friggen Day. In short,
CASPER is great. So, here's the great things about CASPER. I mean, I know that proof of
stake doesn't -- I mean, people are often a little conflicted about it. No, man, proof
of stake is friggin awesome. So, the best thing about proof of stake is that you gain a vastly
bigger stick to beat people with. So, here's the idea. So, in Bitcoin, miners, they behave
because they want to get future rewards from the blockboards. And the more they're in,
the more they can do this. And proof of stake, it's much more explicit. Like it gives you
like -- like you can imagine it's like -- they do something naughty. You can beat them with
like a million-dollar stick immediately. And you just can't do that in Bitcoin. So, you
can imagine a block reward, it's kind of a carrot, where you can make the cow come your
way. You're like, oh, isn't it great? But with proof of stake, you have a ring around
its nose. And you go, yeah. You can really get to do what you want it to do. So, base
proof stake is great. We also have vastly lower inflation rates. So, in proof of work mining,
the biggest cost are both your mining rigs and the electricity. And proof of stake, both
of those get set to zero. And you're like, yeah. So, now we can make pay you like 99%
less. You know? And they're going to put up with it. Because because their costs are
just so much lower. So, you know, and it's great. So, this means a lower inflation rate
for all of us. And we all love low inflation rates. The other one is that it sort of -- it
kills mining cartels while they're in the cradle. So, in Bitcoin, let's have trouble
with mining -- basically, the mining pools having different incentives than the dev
team. And like we all know about that. One nice thing about this is that in proof of
stake, there's no sunk cost into the rig. So, the problem with them -- with the Bitcoin
miners that they've already put in like hundreds of thousands of dollars into these rigs. And
like they just can't -- I mean, they can't just change. Like, I mean, they're really
-- they are locked in. They are locked in. So, as a way -- they will fight tooth and nail.
One nice thing about proof of stake is that there are no mining rigs. So, as a result,
you know, if there's some problem, you're not locked in and you can always go somewhere
else. You can always go invest in a mutual fund or something. Anyway, proof of stake's
great. So, yeah. So, this is the most recent paper by Vitalik and myself. In short, we
